column4: Apparently my login screen has a different resolution(1900x1080) than my desktop resolution(1280x1024). Is there anyway to fix my login window to show a resolution of 1280x1024? It used to be 1280x1024, but randomly changed. I did not play with any configurations before this started happening.
check /etc/X11/xorg.conf , there should be a Modes line near the end. Set that to the res you want
gnoift, ty checking now.
gnoift: hm, that is a first. My xorg.conf has *NO* resolutions listed whatsoever. I can pastebin the xorg.conf if you don't believe me. :P
yeah, that's common now, X is getting smarter.
gnoift: Going to try uninstalling and reinstalling the restricted ATI drivers for my card and see if that works. brb
I don't believe the ubuntu fglrx supports that card, apt-cache show xorg-driver-fglrx lists the chipsets it does support
Yes the restricted drivers work, they were working perfectly before I had to reinstall ubuntu 7.10 on a new hdd
your window decorator/manager crashed, are you using compiz
I am using default GNOME at the moment. Like I said earlier, the only thing I changed was the GDM login screen. Now everything related to the GNOME interface is bugged.
alt+f2 is not bringing up the run window. :(
Checked if gnome-panel was not running, but it is.
you don't see anything on your screen except the background I bet
I can see this xchat and the panels fine, nothing works on the panels except the top panel though. :P
Even then, the functions on the top panel are running extremely slow or not at all
bad bet then. try killall gnome-panel
kk
Hm, even killall gnome-panel isn't making the panels go away heh. It acts like it's closing them, then they reappear. :|

they should return, that's a good sign actually.  In system->prefs->sessions, second tab, you can see the gnome aware apps that are running. If you selected gnome-panel there, you'd see that it was categorized as restart (dropdown just below the text window)
Still no metacity and alt+f2 isn't allowing me to open the run window still.

try this test.  log out, ctl-alt-f1 , hit enter, and log in. do ps -A . If you see any gnome apps, killall them. also killall gconfd-2 , and bonobo-activation if you see them. Then ctl-alt-f7 and log back in.
I mean, I can run metacity from the terminal and it works, but there is an underlying problem somewhere. :x
